column4: I lost power and internet for a while there, if fglrxinfo is saying you have the ati drivers in use, installing xserver-xgl will enable desktop effects

see the problem is that I can get the driver installed...but I get an "out of range" message on the monitor on reboot after the installation...weird thing is, my friend installed it before and had it working, but now when I do it, I get that message on the monitor
I made a change to xorg.conf under the screen section trying to lock to a resolution...I'm thinking maybe refresh rate is killing me, but i'm rather confused about itall
^^ and, possibly the fglrx driver is having issues talking to your monitor. Rare, but it happens. Again, Xorg.0.log will indicate that
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/59742/
that's my log
that's for the ati driver. That looks ok
also, line 1102 is where the ati/radeon driver gets the monitor specs, make sure you have the equiv when you try the fglrx driver
it's doable, done it with many other systems
IT WORKED!!!!
I added the refresh rates as per the log and the 'screen' section as per int_main and now I've got it enabled and video :D
thats a good thing, right ;)
you betcha :D
and run fglrxinfo , make sure it's using ati 8.37.6 drivers
yep
good on that front
install xserver-xgl and compizconfig-settings-manager , log out and back in.
then, system->prefs->appearance  effects tab
ahh, it said the composite extention wasn't there
I'm assuming this enables it
I'm all awesome now ! :D
cool
one more quick question, are there any ATI settings control panel the way there is the "nvidia-settings" to enable dual monitors ?
not that I'm aware of
